summary: This bill, the Puerto Rico BEACHES Act, mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct a study on the impact of coastal erosion on tourism, fisheries, and businesses in Puerto Rico. The study will analyze the effects of erosion, including beach and wetland loss, and produce a report with recommendations to mitigate environmental factors affecting businesses and address industry challenges. The Comptroller General will coordinate with local agencies like the Puerto Rico Department of Natural and Environmental Resources. The bill defines "coastal area" comprehensively.
